document.discussion_title: Dominion Midstream Partners LP (NYSE:DM) Receives Average Recommendation of “Hold” from Brokerages
document.topic_text: Tweet Dominion Midstream Partners LP (NYSE:DM) has received a consensus rating of “Hold” from the eleven analysts that are currently covering the stock, MarketBeat reports . Three research analysts have rated the stock with a sell rating, one has assigned a hold rating and six have issued a buy rating on the company. The average 1-year price objective among analysts that have updated their coverage on the stock in the last year is $39.22. Several brokerages have recently commented on DM. Morgan Stanley began coverage on Dominion Midstream Partners in a report on Thursday, February 25th. They set an “overweight” rating and a $35.00 price objective for the company. Barclays began coverage on Dominion Midstream Partners in a report on Wednesday, April 13th. They set an “overweight” rating and a $33.00 price objective for the company. Finally, Zacks Investment Research lowered Dominion Midstream Partners from a “buy” rating to a “hold” rating in a report on Wednesday, April 20th. In related news, Director Dominion Resources Inc /Va/ purchased 26,850 shares of the business’s stock in a transaction on Thursday, January 28th. The shares were bought at an average cost of $27.04 per share, with a total value of $726,024.00. The acquisition was disclosed in a document filed with the SEC, which is accessible through the SEC website . A number of large investors recently made changes to their positions in DM. Spirit of America Management increased its stake in shares of Dominion Midstream Partners by 44.6% in the fourth quarter. Spirit of America Management now owns 228,452 shares of the company’s stock valued at $7,004,000 after buying an additional 70,450 shares in the last quarter. Endurance Wealth Management Inc. boosted its stake in Dominion Midstream Partners by 15.8% in the fourth quarter. Endurance Wealth Management Inc. now owns 228,006 shares of the company’s stock worth $6,991,000 after buying an additional 31,177 shares during the period. Finally, Hollencrest Securities acquired a new stake in Dominion Midstream Partners during the fourth quarter worth approximately $558,000. Dominion Midstream Partners ( NYSE:DM ) traded up 0.47% on Monday, reaching $31.90. The company’s stock had a trading volume of 31,579 shares. The stock has a market cap of $2.48 billion and a PE ratio of 33.94. The company’s 50 day moving average price is $32.63 and its 200-day moving average price is $30.25. Dominion Midstream Partners has a 12-month low of $23.12 and a 12-month high of $44.34. Dominion Midstream Partners (NYSE:DM) last issued its quarterly earnings data on Tuesday, February 2nd. The company reported $0.32 EPS for the quarter, beating the consensus estimate of $0.30 by $0.02. On average, equities analysts expect that Dominion Midstream Partners will post $1.24 EPS for the current year. The business also recently declared a quarterly dividend, which will be paid on Friday, May 13th. Shareholders of record on Tuesday, May 3rd will be given a dividend of $0.2245 per share. This is an increase from Dominion Midstream Partners’s previous quarterly dividend of $0.21. This represents a $0.90 annualized dividend and a yield of 2.83%. The ex-dividend date is Friday, April 29th. Dominion Midstream Partners, LP ( NYSE:DM ), through its wholly owned subsidiary, Cove Point GP Holding Company, LLC, owns the preferred equity interests and the general partner interest of Dominion Cove Point LNG, LP (Cove Point), which owns liquefied natural gas (LNG) import, storage, regasification and transportation assets. Receive News & Ratings for Dominion Midstream Partners LP Dominion Midstream Partners LP
